query: Alfie, the albatross, flies 400 kilometers every day.  If the circumference of the earth is 40,000 kilometers, how many days will it take Alfie to fly a distance equal to half of the way around the earth?
answers_list:
[reasoning process] To find out how many days it will take Alfie the albatross to fly a distance equal to half of the way around the earth, we start by calculating half of the circumference of the earth. 

The circumference of the earth is 40,000 kilometers, so half of that distance is:
  
\[ 
\text{Half the circumference} = \frac{40,000 \text{ km}}{2} = 20,000 \text{ km} 
\] 

Now that we know Alfie needs to fly 20,000 kilometers, we can determine how many days it will take him to cover that distance given that he flies 400 kilometers each day. 

Next, we can calculate the number of days required for him to fly 20,000 kilometers by dividing this distance by the daily flight distance:

\[ 
\text{Number of days} = \frac{20,000 \text{ km}}{400 \text{ km/day}} 
\] 

Calculating this gives us:

\[ 
\text{Number of days} = 50 \text{ days} 
\] 

[Verification] To verify, we can check by multiplying the number of days by the daily distance to see if it totals to 20,000 kilometers:

\[ 
50 \text{ days} \times 400 \text{ km/day} = 20,000 \text{ km} 
\] 

This confirms our calculation is correct.

[Final Answer] The answer is 50 \n#### 50
